title: Far Away in the Bushveld (1951 - South Africa)[Afrikaans] comedy
description:
Daar Doer in die Bosveld (1951 - South Africa)           Far Away in the Bushveld

Comedy / Romance
 
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0270903/


It would be no exaggeration to describe director Jamie Uys as one of the most important role players in the development of the South African film industry. In his career of nearly half a century, he was responsible for more than 40 films - features, documentaries, and educational shorts. His legacy includes South Africa's single most successful film to date The Gods must be Crazy. Daar doer in die Bosveld, Uys's first film, and South Africa's first colour film, was released in 1951. Irrespective of its many technical flaws the popularity of Daar doer in die Bosveld spread like a wildfire, especially in the rural farming areas.

The film is a comedy about a shy farmer named Hans Botha who is asked to pick up a young school teacher named Martie du Toit. When Hans arrives at the bus stop to pick up Martie he is completely dumbstruck by her beauty and only able to say the phrases, "It looks like rain" and "It was an accident." The two experience many difficulties along the way, mostly due to Hans's ancient car. When the pair arrive at Martie's destination, Martie is soaking wet and convinced that Hans is an idiot. Hans, however, is utterly in love with her.
